alert.note: Alert for Hardee; Highlands; Polk (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 9:07PM EDT until September 29 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Hardee County in central Florida... Southeastern Polk County in central Florida... Northwestern Highlands County in south central Florida... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Southwest Polk and northern Highlands county. Between 4 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 8 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain associated with Hurricane Ian is producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sebring, Sebring Regional Airport, Fort Meade, Frostproof, Bowling Green, Hillcrest Heights, Avon Park Air Force Range, Indian Lake Estates, Babson Park, River Ranch, Lorida and Fort Green. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
